Matching and Subclassification

Author

Lucas Rousselange

Code 
#Load data set and libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(dagitty)
library(ggdag)
library(jtools)
library(kableExtra)
library(MatchIt)
membership <- readRDS("../../../Causal_Data_Science_Data/membership.rds")

Task 1

Exploring the relationships

Plotting a heat map for the available factors, there seems to be a high correlation between age, average purchase and pre membership average purchase.The pre membership average purchase, age and membership card also seem correlated. The sex seems to not have a big influence on either variable.

Code 
mem_cor <- as.data.frame(cor(membership))
mem_heat <- mem_cor %>%
  rownames_to_column() %>%
  gather(colname, value, -rowname)

ggplot(mem_heat, aes(x=colname,y=rowname, fill=value)) + 
  geom_tile(color='black')+
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "white", high = 'blue4')+
  geom_text(aes(label = round(value,2)), color = "black", size = 4) +
  labs(x='', y='', title = 'Heatmap correlation between variables')

DAG

Code 
# Confounder
confounding <- dagify(
  X ~ Z1,
  Y ~ Z1,
  Y ~ X,
  X ~ Z2,
  Y ~ Z2,
  Z2 ~ Z1,
  coords = list(x = c(Y = 3, Z1 = 1, X = 1, Z2=3),
                y = c(Y = 0, Z1 = 1, X = 0, Z2 =1)),
  labels = list(Z2 = "pre_avg_purch",
                Y = "avg_purch",
                Z1 = "age",
                X= 'card')
  )


p <- ggdag(confounding) +
  geom_dag_point(color = "#15c1d4") +
  geom_dag_text(color = "white") +
  geom_dag_edges(edge_color = "black") +
  geom_dag_label_repel(aes(label = label))+
  theme_dag_blank()
p

Task 2

Naive model:

Code 
lm_naive <- lm(avg_purch ~ card, data = membership)
summ(lm_naive)
Observations 10000
Dependent variable avg_purch
Type OLS linear regression
F(1,9998) 1711.91
R² 0.15
Adj. R² 0.15
Est. S.E. t val. p
(Intercept) 65.94 0.40 166.29 0.00
card 25.22 0.61 41.38 0.00
Standard errors: OLS

Task 3

(Coarsened) Exact Matching:

Code 
cem <- matchit(card ~ age + pre_avg_purch,
               data = membership, 
               method = 'cem', 
               estimand = 'ATE')
summary(cem)
#> 
#> Call:
#> matchit(formula = card ~ age + pre_avg_purch, data = membership, 
#>     method = "cem", estimand = "ATE")

lm_cem <- lm(avg_purch ~ card, data = df_cem, weights = weights)

Nearest-Neighbor Matching:

Code 
nn <- matchit(card ~ age + pre_avg_purch,
               data = membership, 
               method = 'cem', 
               estimand = 'ATE')
summary(nn)
#> 
#> Call:
#> matchit(formula = card ~ age + pre_avg_purch, data = membership, 
#>     method = "cem", estimand = "ATE")

df_nn <- match.data(nn)
lm_nn <- lm(avg_purch ~ card, data = df_nn, weights = weights)

Inverse Probability Weighting:

Code 
# (1) Propensity scores
model_prop <- glm(card ~ age + pre_avg_purch,
                  data = membership,
                  family = binomial(link = "logit"))
summary(model_prop)
#> 
#> Call:
#> glm(formula = card ~ age + pre_avg_purch, family = binomial(link = "logit"), 
#>     data = membership)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                 Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
#> (Intercept)   -1.4121735  0.0723729 -19.512   <2e-16 ***
#> age            0.0011734  0.0017758   0.661    0.509    
#> pre_avg_purch  0.0148181  0.0009263  15.996   <2e-16 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> (Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)
#> 
#>     Null deviance: 13626  on 9999  degrees of freedom
#> Residual deviance: 13250  on 9997  degrees of freedom
#> AIC: 13256
#> 
#> Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
Code 
# Add propensities to table
membership_aug <- membership %>% mutate(propensity = predict(model_prop, type = "response"))

# Extend data by IPW scores
membership_ipw <- membership_aug %>% mutate(
  ipw = (card/propensity) + ((1-card) / (1-propensity)))

# Run with high weights excluded
lm_ipw <- lm(avg_purch ~ card,
                data = membership_ipw %>% filter(propensity %>% between(0.15, 0.85)),
                weights = ipw)
summ(lm_ipw)
Observations 10000
Dependent variable avg_purch
Type OLS linear regression
F(1,9998) 599.18
R² 0.06
Adj. R² 0.06
Est. S.E. t val. p
(Intercept) 70.26 0.43 162.65 0.00
card 14.95 0.61 24.48 0.00
Standard errors: OLS

Summary

Code 
modelsummary::modelsummary(list("Naive" = lm_naive,
                                "CEM1"  = lm_cem,
                                "NN"    = lm_nn,
                                "IPW1"  = lm_ipw))
